intro: Dasyglossum anthoxanthum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered dasyglossum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disc florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
